website_summaries.verdict: A great multi-tool for people who don't want to spend a lot and need basic components in a small, lightweight unit.
pros: Offers 19 tools in a compact, lightweight design that's less than 2 inches long and will fit on a key ring
cons: It can be difficult to remove from key ring

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tiny Tools
customer_reviews.text: FULL DISCLOSURE: I didn't buy this tool with the intent of it being super useful. I mainly got it, because it was tiny & sorta cool :) That being said I have used it a few times since purchase and it is indeed functional. Some of the 19 tools are ridiculous to try to use with my larger hands but the main ones (pliers, screwdrivers, wire stripper) work just fine! And for what I paid for it, I feel like I got my moneys worth. Plus it sits on my keys perfectly and doesn't get int he way. I consider this a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: A. Pointer

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a stocking stuffer for my step dad for Christmas. He's a mechanic and a general handy man where his family is concerned. One of his kids always has something that needs "tinkering" so I thought he could keep this on hand for the tinker emergencies. The tool seems kind of small to be effective, he said he really liked it and he carries it with him. I have never seen him use it, so it might be to not hurt my feelings. The concept seems really great though so I hope he's getting a lot of impromptu use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Eogeaux

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, surprises people
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my ex when we were dating, he used it every once in a while, but he got himself a Leathermen multitool instead. So he didn't need mine anymore, it was more of a decorative keychain at that point. I bought one for myself since I usually don't need much, but I've had to use it pretty often lately and I'm glad for it. The tools seem to not fold snugly into one another anymore though. So if I hold it up, some will come unfurled. Not sure how to tighten it. It'd be hilarious if I needed a tool to tighten the tool itself...
customer_reviews.author: Kim S

customer_reviews.title: Like a tool belt in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace one of the Swiss-Tech tools with fewer screwdrivers. I LOVE IT! I have already used it a number of times when changing batteries and doing other small tasks around the house. The screws on the battery compartment required the smallest Phillips head, so I wouldn't have been able to do it with the 6-in-1 tool. I keep it on my keychain so it is always with me. Very well made. Lots of uses. Nice heft. Like a toolbelt in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Vilberg

customer_reviews.title: Great value for small carry with you multitool
customer_reviews.text: First, this item passes through airport security without trouble. And it should as it does not have a blade. Second, it has several Phillips and slot screwdriver heads, in addition to the other tools. It is small, about the size of a silver dollar, but square and about twice as thick. For its size, it is heavy. Will it hold up to heavy use? doubtful. Will it out perform your finger nail or some other improvised screw driver or small plier? Definitely and by a wide margin.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Dave

customer_reviews.title: The arms worked loose. The plier jaws separated. It fell off the keyring.
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved to love this multitool. It's very pretty and lightweight, and it seems well made. But after carrying it every day on my keyring and after it survived a handfull of sessions of jogging and jumping in the park, it worked itself open and wound up on the ground. If it hadn't hit my ankle, I might not have ever known whatever became of it. Bottom line: The arms worked loose and then the plier jaws separated ever so slightly, but enough for the key ring to slip through. If only this multi-tool had a key fob or a little hole or something to put a keyring through, I still would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Adipatus Sutapida

customer_reviews.title: Quality undesirable
customer_reviews.text: The SwissTech (Made-in-China) one is not as good a quality as it used to be. I broke mine the first time I used it and returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: My hubby's go-to favorite gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this tool 3 times, and each guy that received it absolutely loves it! My hubby finds uses for it every day, and it would be a great tool to carry in your go bag or for mom's to have in the car. He's had his for over 3 years now and it's just like new. He's rough with it and it's holding up great! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MtnLady

customer_reviews.title: neat little tool, once you get the one you ordered
customer_reviews.text: Small versatile little tool that fits on your keychain. Also ends up being somewhat of a fidget device at times. :) Ended up being quite a debacle in receiving the model I ordered, which is the little 19-in-1 that fits on your keyring. Received a larger 22-in-1 version, and kept receiving them as replacements because some sellers just go by the UPC stickers instead of looking at stuff before they send it out apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice... But....
customer_reviews.text: Appear to be a very well made product, but after a short time the pin that holds it together got loose and now it flip open and fall off may key right. And with loose handles it is almost impossible to use. I hammered the pin and it is fine now, but I expect this will continue to happen until I simply loose it all together. PS: Wish it had a knife instead of one of the many screwdrivers.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G.

customer_reviews.title: Moderately Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I got three: one for myself and one for each of my two grown sons. It's not the kind of think I'd want to stuff in my pants pocket: too many sharp edges. I've only used it once, when I needed a particularly small screwdriver -- it worked fine. For me it seems to be a solution looking for a set of problems (problems that apparently I don't have). It was an impulse buy.
customer_reviews.author: Websquad

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight tool - quality construction
customer_reviews.text: This tool is very well made, weighs under 2 ounces and has a variety of functions, the most important being the screw drivers and pliers. Product has an ingenious design which allows easy use of any of the tools. The pricing is good considering the versatility and quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aruba

customer_reviews.title: and although I will likely never reach for this tool during my normal work day it feels like a very well made quality tool that
customer_reviews.text: I deal with tools every day of my life. and although I will likely never reach for this tool during my normal work day it feels like a very well made quality tool that I keep on my keys for those little surprises in life. Anyone who works with tools of any kind knows how cruddy it is to be without them during every day life because someone will always ask you to take a look or fix something when they find out you know how. nothing dissapoints someone more than saying oh I cant help you I don't have my tools. This multi tool will at least give you a few options in "dire" situations,
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Well Design, compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so compact and it can easily lock to your key ring. Pros: Well design, looks like a quality product. It's so well made I dont think it will ever break. With the locking trick it usees, it can easily be out of the ring when in use. You dont have to roll by the ring to take it out of the ring. Cons: It should require a cap to cover the sharpe end. If you are attaching it with your car/home keys and always put the keys in your pocket, it may create some holes in you pocket. Overall its a good buy and a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: This is Tiny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a stocking stuffer for my husband this Christmas. I am going to say that in this instance I was one of those people that didn't read description properly or look at photos properly - very unusual for me, and thought this was bigger than what was actually delivered. Having gone back and re-read and looked properly this product is exactly as described, MIRCO. It is tiny tiny tiny. we are stilling figuring out how to use it, it may or may not get used. it will get put in the camping box to take away with us if we need it, but for general stuff normal tools are more appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Great little multipurpose tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to keep in my bathroom kit when I travel. It doesn't take up much room and it's nice to have a few simple tools handy in case I need them. Granted, it will not do the job of a regular sized plier or screwdriver but it will come in handy in an emergency! I love how compact it is and the weight of it- it doesn't feel flimsy. This simple tool is so much better than one of those multiple tool army knives. It's much less bulky but still is capable of the same functions. This would make a great stocking stuffer!
customer_reviews.author: linda crawford kober

customer_reviews.title: Handy little guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! One thing most multi-tools have a lack of is varying sized screwdrivers. Makes sense though, they try to pack as much as they can in a small size. This tool is a great supplement to have. I close the jaws of the pliers around a belt loop and basically forget about it until I need it. I pretty much only use it for the screwdrivers, but for that purpose, it's perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Fairly useful multi-tool that doesn't take up much space.
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and cleverly designed. It is good for small tasks where you don't want to get your tool box from the basement. It is a bit small for big hands to use but that makes it very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Bret D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Solid and compact
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid little multi tool that fits on my keychain. Not a replacement for a full toolbox, of course, but great when you just need to turn that one screw right now, or have use for a fiddley but convenient set of pliers. Overkill for a bottle opener, but hey it’s got that too.
customer_reviews.author: Skylark Landing

customer_reviews.title: Castle of Tools
customer_reviews.text: I call it my castle as it sort of looks like one when hanging from my keychain. After months of carrying it, I eventually had to put a rubberband around it to keep the arms from swivelling where they could potentially catch on something or accidentally unclasp the tool from my keychain. It's also heavy for a keychain so I have to be careful about where I place it on the ring to maintain balance. Overall, though, it's a great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Pocktpoker

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Tool
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding pocket tool, purchased this item over regular multitools which were more expensive and had less multi tools to use. This swiss tech key ring tool is the best tool to take on travel esp. international travel has multi uses and for emergency etc., and sizing is exceptional great and doesn't take up any space etc., Wish I had purchased this mult-tool prior to my recent international travel it would have come in handy for opening electronics, toys and other items while on travel. Highly recommend for purchase and to take on trips. Done a lot of research on multi tools and this fits the bill for my use on travel accessoriies needed.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the tiny size. Maybe its my fault for not reading this carefully. But this thing arrived and it is literally tiny. Its about 1 inch tall! I was going to give it as a gift, but its not good enough bc of the size and the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Haley P.

customer_reviews.title: Clever little multi tool but quality isn't up to daily use
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those people who carry a pocket flashlight, multi tool, and pocket knife. I'm always on the lookout for a smaller one, lighter one, more useful one, etc. The concept is good but the material used in the execution isn't durable. The screwdriver bits are bent having tried to loosen corroded or too tight screws. The pliers joint is now sloppy. The price was (is) low enough to take a chance. It does carry a lifetime warranty. However what constitutes misuse or abuse? The warranty procedure makes it difficult to justify the effort required given the cost to replace it or just toss it in the drawer...
customer_reviews.author: Chuck in Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: It was alright until the hinges came loose
customer_reviews.text: I was going to put it on my key chain just so I could have some small tools in case of emergency. However, within a week of using it on small projects (Building extensions for an animal cage), the hinges holding the whole thing together became loose and floppy. I can no longer even keep it on my key chain as it easily comes undone. Would be a fine product if that hadn't happened, now it's just about useless. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexia

customer_reviews.title: Overall, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The first day I received it I was actually able to put this product to good use when taking apart my computer. It's small enough to fit into the tight places a normal screwdriver cannot. Pros: Has many different tools, feels well built/designed, great for tight spaces. Cons: It's a little heavy on the keychain but not terrible, occasionally difficult to use screwdrivers in some places. Can I just say that this product is under $10, so anyone really complaining about it is nitpicking. It works just fine for most screws (No you're not going to use it for every project), but it works quite well for most applications
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: ... a couple of times since I got it and like a swiss army knife it is not a replacement ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item a couple of times since I got it and like a swiss army knife it is not a replacement for a real screwdriver. If you need a screw driver you should get a screw driver. In a pinch this might work, but even then I am looking for a better multi tool. While trying to use it the tool flops around and never stays where you want it. The middle screwdriver bit is very short so it can't get into deep areas like kids toys when you need to change a battery. I actually ground down my middle bit so it can reach deeper into those areas.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy V.

customer_reviews.title: One of the beat gadget buys ever. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased 2 of these one for a friend and one for myself. I have adapted this as my key ring so that I always have a tool no matter where I am. It has come in handy loads of times under so many circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: SIZE MATTERS
customer_reviews.text: This is a slight improvement over the original Swiss-Tech device in that it is slightly bigger..Hey Swiss-Tech make it much bigger and you'll have something! Getting 19 tools is a stretch. If you count the scales etched on some of the parts maybe there is... On the other hand having SOME tools with you is OK. Being able to tighten a couple of nuts or screws would help now wouldn't it? The crimper is a farce. It's too small. See the comment about bigger above. The very small [too small] gimlet would help to start a screw in wood or plastic but it might break if you tried it too many times. Make it bigger and you really have something!
customer_reviews.author: IMHOTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: They loved that it was a key chain and it had ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge hit with my step dad who has every tool available. He sat at the Christmas table and tinkered with this thing for every! Then all the other guys wanted to check it out. They loved that it was a key chain and it had so many different features! He said he would probably forget all it could do :)
customer_reviews.author: Reviews

customer_reviews.title: A company can be judged on two things: Quality and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: A company can be judged on two things; 1. It's product quality. 2. It's customer service. Swiss Tech passes the test on both. I bought my Swiss Tech and after about a month had a few problems. It was loose. I emailed Swiss Tech and within a week, a brand-new Swiss Tech. It is a Great product and they have great customer service. That's Swiss Tech.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: I had it since 2014 and it worked great initially, but now it's loosened up so much ...
customer_reviews.text: I had it since 2014 and it worked great initially, but now it's loosened up so much it won't stay on my keychain anymore. I can't carry it around anymore and will have to try something else :(
customer_reviews.author: ecroFoM

customer_reviews.title: Good product - great pocket tool
customer_reviews.text: This one will fit on a keychain. It was one of two similar gadgets I bought my husband for Christmas. He loved both and put this one on his keychain. It provides that one little tool you need without having to go dig in the tool box, or if you're away from home, it may keep you from being stuck on the side of the road, depending upon what problem you're having.
customer_reviews.author: J in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but too easy to lose.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, very useful but WATCH OUT. This thing is supposed to clip on your keychain and it does, but it falls off easily. All it takes is a slight movement of one arm and the jaws open, thus the tool unclips from the keychain. This happened to me several times but I always found it, until today. Now it is in some parking lot somewhere in the city. Would I buy this again? NO Not until they come up with a better method of latching the jaws closed so they don't open until you want them to.
customer_reviews.author: DigiKiwamTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool for travelers
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for what it is, a great multitool which also has measuring capability (pretty rare to find). The flat head and phillips head work great in everything I've tried, the wrench functionality is also awesome. This pocket tool has gone past TSA here in Dallas at Love Field about 6 times now without problems. Only minor complaint is it feels kinda wonky to use the screwdrivers for extended time due to the tiny handle size.. But honestly that is to be expected when you have such a tiny tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and ready to use on the spot
customer_reviews.text: Very unique design and it is very compact. Everything seems very functional except the ruler (and extender) are hard to use and some of the lines on the extender are only partially etched out, making it harder to use. Overall I look forward to using in a tight jam!
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: I'm a cable tech.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this as a trip saver. Sometimes I go to a trouble call and forget a tool in the car. Sadly the 1/4" next wench makes the 7/16" essentially unusable and it's the whole reason I bought it for. Would love a version that eliminates 1/4" and the crimper I never use in place for a better 7/16
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Nicely finished/polished stainless steel mini-tool.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Nicely finished/polished stainless steel mini-tool. A bit heavy bulky for the size on a key chain but you must weight the convenience of having an array of Phillips and flat tip screwdriver points (no hex or Torx points) and a mini-plier at your disposal whenever you need it. When closed up/collapsed, the plier head clamps to a key chain and stays there. There are no knife/cutting blades to get you crossed up with the TSA agent at US airports. I still miss my oh-so-handy mini Swiss Army Executive key chain knife of pre-9/11 days...
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatic

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how many times you use something like this during your week when you carry it in your pocket. Good, compact answer for many small spur of the moment jobs.
customer_reviews.author: K. B. Mason

customer_reviews.title: May not be Swisstek tool
customer_reviews.text: Careful this may not be an actual Swisstek. Product is slightly larger but does include a knife blade. Seems ok but NOT A SWISSTEK.
customer_reviews.author: fred paddock

customer_reviews.title: At least it has pliers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically because it had a pair of pliers on it and it seems that I always need one of those at random times. While this feature is great some of the others make make scratch my head. When am I ever going to measure less than an inch, or file my nails down? Some of the smaller screwdrivers I'm afraid to use becuase I know anything less than a loose tighten and they will deform. Overall I still like it becuase it has a pair of pliers on it and a few useful bits.
customer_reviews.author: R. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not practical
customer_reviews.text: Very cute, but too small for leverage to tighten a real screw.
customer_reviews.author: E. olton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money if you can use it
customer_reviews.text: The tool has no ring for putting on a keychain. You close the jaws on the keychain you have and lock them closed. This works o.k. but has fallen off my keyring twice because the jaws do not close completely and the small gap sometimes works its way off. The tools are o.k. but four of the tools are related to two rulers in inches and centimeters and are useless. So far it has saved me a few trips to the toolbox which is all you can really hope for. I'd buy it again because it suits my needs but if anything better came along, even at twice the price, it would be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: This tool isn't the lightest or the most appealing looking, but it's got it where it counts. I put it on my keychain on the first day I had it. since then, it's been in almost constant use when I don't have my leatherman. Definitely a lifesaver. Easy to put on and take off a keychain. Easy to use. Good quality. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Hatridge

customer_reviews.title: It easily fits in the watch pocket of a pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: I lost one of these and HAD to replace it. It easily fits in the watch pocket of a pair of Levi's. I do have a "real" multi-tool, but don't like to wear it on my belt all the time (not a look I'm striving for). With this little tool, I can have it in a suit pocket and be handy without looking like a yahoo. The perfect companion to this is the Gerber 45898 Ridge Knife. It's 2" long and does anything I'd ever need a knife to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Philpott

customer_reviews.title: Love it, great size and a solid build.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Multi-tool, fits perfectly on my keys and just the right size. I have confirmed that wire stripping does work and also holds pretty well on keys with out coming lose unless doing something like running/jogging may cause legs to shift a bit causing it to open. Overall great product which I definitely recommend really comes in handy when you least expect it!!
customer_reviews.author: Overcomerx

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Little Gadget with Plenty of Functions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy in the midst of a multitool obsession phase I went through a couple years back. This one was one of the better ones of its kind, although over time (and not due to using it) the joints loosened quite a bit and lost their smooth tension they once had. I don't believe I ever actually used it but it definitely has a ton of functions in a perfectly compact little size. Perfect for your keychain or to just throw into your glove box or go bag for a just in case scenario. Its definitely a space saver, I'll give it that.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Prosser

customer_reviews.title: glad i had it
customer_reviews.text: smaller than i thought but i went fishing on the spur of the moment and needed to use this tool to remove a heavily treble hooked bass ...glad i had it.
customer_reviews.author: dan l.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern before purchasing this tool was that it might feel cheap and flimsy. Its not cheap or flimsy. This little device is solid and fits easily on your key chain or in your pocket. It is slightly smaller than I expected it to be, and, for me, that is a good thing. I loved it so much after opening it that I went back on and ordered another one for a friend who likes these types of pocket tool gadgets. I have plenty of small pocket knives, but could never find a tool set like this for me to carry around. I am glad I finally found it.
customer_reviews.author: Ayato

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I have a feeling that this neat little gadget will prove itself useful time and again. I've already used the screwdrivers a few times in the past couple of days because it is so convenient and I don't have to go digging around to find one. It is built solidly and I don't foresee any problems with durability in the future. It fits nicely on my key ring and I would say it is the perfect size, not too small to use, and not too bulky for my key ring.
customer_reviews.author: R. Viator

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this little handy key chain tool ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this little handy key chain tool. Bought it kinda of as a gag gift for co-workers and extended family. It keeps them occupied and buys you a little time to get away from them at the Christmas family get together. Although they do follow-up with "where did you find this handy little tool", so just remember when you hand it to them just say "You can't beat shopping at Amazon!", then they won't look for you after your escape to ask where you got it.
customer_reviews.author: tiff

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a Gimmick
customer_reviews.text: All in all, this is pretty useless. Not ergonomic at all. Having more than one size of the same type of screwdriver on such a small tool is a waste of the limited space. And the "drill" or what ever they call it is completely useless. Better to buy a real multi-tool, i.e. Leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: JoadBowie

customer_reviews.title: Respectable
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small little multitool for everyday use, and this thing turned out to be perfect. It's not magnetic, so you can use it on computers, and the screwdrivers and pliers are fairly substantial. One thing though, sorry Swiss, but rulers are NOT a function. That's kind of lame. One more weird thing, it has a very tiny hand drill. What would I ever need a 1/2mm hand drill for? Seriously. Otherwise it's all solid stainless steel. The joints are pretty secure, but one is a bit more loose than the other. 4/5 because they made rulers a feature.
customer_reviews.author: Cody J.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what I was expecting for only $8.
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to add this to my keys as a utility item. Unless you are the type of person who has huge key chain and is okay with that you most likely will find it to bulky an addition. Doubly so If you keep your keeps in you pocket (It may work well as a purse item). It does get decent use as an additional bottle opener. I can never seem to find one when I need one so it is nice to have around. However I have never found a use for it other then a bottle open that almost anything else (think MacGyver) would do the job better.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre tool for the lowest impact work
customer_reviews.text: The design isn't terribly flawed, but it seems that this is obviously drop forged and then left almost entirely unmachined, put together and sold. Not what I expected from a Swiss+ tool. Gap in the pliers grip, pitted metal, and a rivet holding everything together. Is there something you can get that's better, for $7? Not likely. Spend 15 and get something cheap from SnapOn
customer_reviews.author: The_Grinch

customer_reviews.title: Very nifty little tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made stainless steel multitool. The man tools are a small pliers, six different screwdrivers, three Phillips and three flat head. The wire stripper works tolerably well on things like low voltage wire and coax cable if you just need to strip a few wires and don't want to get your big stripper. The screwdrivers are really useful to have when you need one or two screws tightened and you always put it off because you don't want to get a screwdriver. At this price, you really can't beat the quality and utility.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Nice little novelty gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I like these little tools and pick one up every once in a while to check them out. I don't think this would be very practical on a key ring or as an actual tool. They expect the gap behind the pliers jaw to go around the key ring and keep it on the ring. There is enough slop in the tool where I can see it coming off the key ring pretty easily. The smallest Philips head screwdriver would not work on my glasses, the tip was too rounded to fit the screw. As a novelty I think this tool is fun. As a practice pocket tool I am not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dowd

customer_reviews.title: handy little tool!
customer_reviews.text: I carry this in my wallet. I've been amazed both by how small it is, and how amazingly useful it is! I use it all the time! People are amazed when there is need for a screwdriver or pliers, and I pull out my wallet. But so far it's worked every time. Also, if you travel a lot, might be helpful to note that I've been through airport security several times in both the US and Europe, and have never had any trouble. The TSA agents don't even give it a second glance.
customer_reviews.author: DavidTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend. A few days ago he told me one of the sides was loose and the tool was not working correctly. I went and requested it to be replaced. I requested it late Friday night and received a new one on SUNDAY afternoon. This was the easiest return I have ever had to make. I would buy from them again! The tool itself is great quality and a great addition to a handyman's key chain! I would highly recommend to anyone! UPDATE: Although they have fantastic customer service, the second product I have received has also come loose and is not working properly. I am very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie K.

customer_reviews.title: TSA Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Can’t complain. I work at airport so need something TSA friendly. Only have to use it every once in a while. I don’t know about getting it for a gift because it’s an inexpensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Duckbutter

customer_reviews.title: What I Was Trying to Replace - Better and Close, but Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I never give 5 stars, and this is why. I bought this as a replacement for a smaller one that I lost. When I got this I went nuts over it and gave it a glowing 5 stars. I am reducing that to 4 because the more experienced reviewers said that the tools quickly became loose. They were right. I have to keep a bar magnet on one side to keep them in line. Still a handy tool, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Butler

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Little tool, loose closure to come
customer_reviews.text: While I had this on my keychain, it was a great little tool. Many, many uses for fixing those small things you don’t have a screwdriver for at random times. However, the closure on the pliers end did wear out within a few months of use and would come off my keys quite often as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Buford

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: The tools rivit came loose. Seemed like a cool tool years ago when this first came out. Very awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: oneeyedman

customer_reviews.title: Over. Rated.
customer_reviews.text: From the point of view of a person who always carries a full-sized multi-tool on me, this key-chain tool does not seem that great. I would rather augment my multi-tool with the Leatherman Style CS, which provides scissors and tweezers. Also it is much lighter than this bulky tool. However, if a person doesn't have a full-sized multi-tool, this will at least provide you with several sizes of Phillipp's and standard screwdriver heads. I just think the design could be better.
customer_reviews.author: The Honey Badger

customer_reviews.title: A useful, handy tool
customer_reviews.text: For something that latches onto your keyring (in a rather unique way, but locking the plier jaws around your keyring), this tool is pretty versatile. I have used both sets of screwdrivers, and once you figure out the best ergonomic approach for leverage, they work well. Tough, solid seating philips, something you could pretty much give anyone as a gift, and they'd end up using it sooner than they think. Not a leatherman by no means, but for a micro tool option, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: George D. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Really really really tiny
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift and had to get something else. Very teeny tiny. I mean really really really tiny. Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.author: SherryKing

customer_reviews.title: mmcsss 19-1 micro
customer_reviews.text: Item looks nice in picture has a decent weight to it as a micro too but hanging as a key chain to heavy on car key start, to much weight is hard on the keying unit. The phillips and flathead that am forward can/have poked and stabbed through the pant pockets. The hex for one of the sizes does not complete on one side. some of the tools are just to impractacle to use on a regular basis as with a regular size multitool. I know its a micro but a good amount of applications it will not fulfill. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: cool mini-tool.
customer_reviews.text: Swiss+Tech ST53100 Polished SS 19-in-1 Micro...: cool mini-tool... a mancave toolbox pocket floater... grandkids raved for weeks about the tool, their dad keeps his in his pocket... Not a Snap-on of Craftsman grade, but like the imported econo type of tool.. Buy a two-pack and save... gave several as Xmas gifts to the family members...
customer_reviews.author: John G. Kierecki

customer_reviews.title: Nice stocking stuffer
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought these for my boys for Christmas. They enjoyed having their own pocket tool, and no knife on it to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: MDickson17

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I've carried one of these for many years but lost and HAD TO replace it. It was a tool that was there when I needed one. It's sturdy and we'll made. It's small but very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl l.

customer_reviews.title: Just brilliant for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have Leatherman's, Swiss Army knives etc. I bought this little gadget for the guys in the family for Christmas. As soon as the wrapping paper was off all of them were digging in with typical guy smiles when given a gadget. I also have one on my key ring now. It is one of those items that once you have it you wonder what you used to do without it. I have repaired my glasses while on a plane (so yes TSA is good with it), pulled out a splinter and fixed my daughters battery compartment on a toy. Great value for money and it does what it says on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: AJWKM

customer_reviews.title: Fun little tool
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a family member who was overjoyed with the versatility of the tool, Which easily fit in the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: I love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy,it's so awesome.i already had the previous one and was already pleased with that one,so when I seen the upgraded version I just had to get a new one
customer_reviews.author: MrImmoral

customer_reviews.title: You would do better with a cheap leatherman than this thing
customer_reviews.text: i haven't used this little device as yet. I can see if its the only thing you have it will do some things annoyingly as its just to small. You would do better with a cheap leatherman than this thing. i think its meant to be attached to your keychain and its to heavy for that.
customer_reviews.author: kevin Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Very small, handy little tool. I read the description but was surprised at how small it was in person. I ordered it to keep in the kitchen drawer so I could have easy access to common tools without having to dig out my toolbox. Would have been nice if it had a blade, and honestly, if it were just a little bigger. The screwdrivers are fine as long as you don't have to access screws far down in plastic cases.
customer_reviews.author: SomeNYCGuy

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He hates the bulky multitool I got him a few years ago for being in his pocket. It is heavy and he says it makes his pants fall down when he carries it, so I saw this and thought he HAD to have it! When I got it, I couldn't believe how lightweight and compact it is compared to its predecessor! Perfect! He will love this! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Hanging on my keychain.
customer_reviews.text: The second one, actually. While the tools are limited, they're handy and a lot better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Like A Transformer For Your Keyring
customer_reviews.text: The Megatron of Mini-Tools. Keep in mind, this thing is going to be WAY smaller than it appears in the photo. When folded up, less than 1-1/2" wide. Also, don't try to knuckle down on a seriously stubborn bolt with the pliers, because the torque is all on the hinges. However, the selection of precision Phillips and flathead screwdrivers is remarkable. Screwdriver selection alone is worth twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Workman

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Barely had mine in my hands for a day, before it occurred to me that it would fit in my daughter's purse and give her 19 tools in 1, all slightly larger than a silver dollar. It never even made it to my keychain. But the next one will, because I'm getting another. Do thou likewise, especially if thou hath daughters to trouble your mind with worry... what if she needs a (----)? She'll have it.
customer_reviews.author: Wodehousian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compliment to a full-size multi-tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for! Needed something that had smaller screwdrivers and phillips than my Leatherman without carrying around a lot of tips, and this is almost perfect. Taking a star off for the small phillips: Could have been a great 00 phillips if it were cut properly, but the flutes were a bit filled in making it basically useless for small phillips screws. Since I value this as a multi-tool for small components, it's definitely loss of a star for that!
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set of tools highly recommend it small enough perfect for every day use
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of tools highly recommend it small enough perfect for every day use
customer_reviews.author: Russell Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these because I have an older model that has about half as many functions, but the fit, finish and precision of this new stainless steel model is just not as good as the old black oxide model. The older model was so precise that the pliers would not open without extending the legs all the way, allowing it to be "locked" to a key ring or a lanyard when the tools are folded as shown in the picture. With the new model, the fit is so loose that the pliers open 1/16" to 1/8" even when all the tools are fully folded.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. They still have and use it after these years.
customer_reviews.author: Bobs stuff

customer_reviews.title: Good tools guys
customer_reviews.text: My step son in law is suddenly McGuyver, Good tools guys!
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Protocol

customer_reviews.title: Loose rivets hinder effectiveness and portability
customer_reviews.text: My score is not based on the product's efficiency or usability. Please understand that a tool this portable may not provide enough torque to get even some simple jobs done, but it has its uses. My score is justified by the rather weak center rivet that holds both halves together. My tool loosened within a few days of use to the point that it will not hold onto my keychain. Also loose are the rivets that secure the arms of the tool. I still keep the tool around but it is now secured with a rubberband.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing for a portable Bottle opener purposes. the product came in flimsey and the key ring hole was slightly open by 2 MM which leaves room for it to fall through the ring. The bottle opener for lack of a better word is a terrible design because it's very difficult to use for such a simple task.
customer_reviews.author: Mewzhik

customer_reviews.title: but either way love it great product can fit in your pocket or ...
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to see how small this was. took me by surprised expected something that was regular sized. i forgot to read the part where it says it's MINI 19 in 1. but either way love it great product can fit in your pocket or key chain
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality But.........
customer_reviews.text: All these tiny tools are just way to fiddly to be of any real help. The quality is good with this one but it needs to fold out another inch. The screwdrivers are just about usable but the pliers and bottle opener and cutter part are really awkward nearly to the point of being ridiculous. Maybe someone with smaller hands, but for me, I'm looking for someone to give this too.
customer_reviews.author: M. marsden

customer_reviews.title: It does it job. For the most part.
customer_reviews.text: This pocket tool is really nice. It has most tools you could need on a daily basis. However it does have some shortcoming. First of all it would be the key ring. The sides get loose so if they move (like while they are dangling on the car) the tool will fall. Also, if you try to use the pliers the handles are loose as well so its a bit harder to use. Aside from that it does do well when needed. It is lightweight and and really small.
customer_reviews.author: Esepe

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these several months ago and carried it in my pocket every day. I use it probably once every week or so and it's great knowing that if I ever need it it's in my pocket. It has a very compact and light design so it's easy to take around everywhere. It even has no blades so it is safe to take to any event with security or even into airports (although they will spend a few minutes looking it over to make sure it's safe). I even lost one of these and ended up buying another because I can't live without it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Wow, really versatile multitool
customer_reviews.text: Nice stainless steel multitool for the money. The recipients were quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: cool pocket tool
customer_reviews.text: cool pocket tool. i keep it on my keychain and have used it - screwdrivers and bottle opener - several times already (i've had it for a 10 days). i was kinda bummed when i realized it didn't have a blade and i expected it to have one for some reason. i haven't tried the wire cutters yet, though.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as hoped
customer_reviews.text: Was happy at first but after having it for a few weeks it won't stay all put together. Part keep poking me. I don't thing I'm going to be able to use it as a key chain any longer and will have to purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Small gadgetry gift I bought my husband as a just ...
customer_reviews.text: Small gadgetry gift I bought my husband as a just because gift...he loves gadgets but it really is too small I thought even as a keychain.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.Historian

customer_reviews.title: A pocket multi tool worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Super handy to have on your keychain. Great for tightening screws on your glasses or hose clamps on your car in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Doshu L. Tokeshi

customer_reviews.title: Best value pocket/keychain tool 19 functions!
customer_reviews.text: Swiss has maintained their quality control on this item over the, everything works from the drill to the pliers/2 socket set.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan O.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient screwdriver package
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool to carry on your keychain. I mainly use the flat heads and philips heads but have found myself using this thing many times randomly. The wrench doesn't really work all too well due to the design because the screwdrivers are the handles and can easily rotate throwing off your leverage. Update: Lost this tool after it fell off my keychain and didn't notice. The two side sections can rotate too easily after awhile and it becomes too unsecured.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: ST53100
customer_reviews.text: You need this! If you're into light weight EDC, this multi tool is pretty amazing. 19in, Solid, light, clamps and closes as a keychain. This design is brilliant. If you already carry, a light, a pocket knife, wallet, shades, smartphone, handgun + X mag ect...you start thinking how you can minimize weight. This is a creative way. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Arquilla

customer_reviews.title: Hey, it works
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit stiff out of package, but a bit of 3-in-1 oil and moving it around loosened it right up. The tools are solid, no issues there, but the casting of the parts is a bit rough. could have done a little better there, but on the other hand, it's a $7 keychain tool. The rulers are pretty poorly designed, so that's something, but again, you're not really carrying this thing to use as a ruler. I just think it's a bit shady to list such a poorly designed tool as a "function". honestly, it's more a 15-in-1 than a 19-in-1.
customer_reviews.author: jbucky1092

customer_reviews.title: Most useful present ever
customer_reviews.text: Out of the many Christmas presents I got him, this $9 multi tool I bought as a stocking stuffer ended up being my boyfriends favorite gift. I wasn't expecting much of it, but even with daily use it's still holding up on his keyring. He even went as far as to tell me it's the most useful present he's ever received! Thank you Swiss+Tech!
customer_reviews.author: Carley

customer_reviews.title: Such a handy little device!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how many times this has been useful already. Because I take it with my everywhere as a keychain, it is always there when I need a screw driver or bottle opener. Great idea! It is small enough to fit easily into your pocket, but the weight of it could be annoying to some. As long as you keep your keychain clutter free and minimize the keys you carry around, the weight is no problem at all. I wish the pliers came all the way together at the top when closed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fike

product_meta.title: Swiss+Tech ST53100 Polished SS 19-in-1 Micro Pocket Multitool for Camping, Outdoors, Hardware
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackSwiss+Tech Micro-Max 19-in-1 Multi-Function Tool Set, 2 hex wrenches, screwdrivers, pliers, bottle opener, wire cutter, wire stripper, wire crimper, hand drill, file, 2 rulers, 2 ruler extensions. Made of solid stainless steel. Attaches to keychain or key ring and can be quickly released when needed.

AMAZON.COM


Swiss+Tech represents a quantum leap in the art of micro-tool making. They're compact, easily transportable tools that combine craftsmanship and innovation to create a new category of patented consumer products--Key Ring Tools. 

19 tools in a single, portable keyring tool Unlike all other multi-function tools, many Swiss+Tech tools have a patented, quick-release, integrated locking system that attaches to any key ring, thereby eliminating the need for an additional ring or belt holster. These innovative, high-quality, light-weight products fulfill a common need--having the tools you need when you need them. They make a great gift.

The Micro-Max 19-in-1 Series offers Swiss+Tech's most comprehensive and versatile set of tools to date. This solid stainless steel tool set, with its patented, quick-release and self-locking mechanism, folds out into 19 different professional-grade tools. Everyday tools for everyday convenience. Tighten, loosen, wire, drill, file, open and measure with ease. Includes 2 hex wrenches, 6 screwdrivers, pliers, wire cutter, wire stripper, wire crimper, hand drill, file, bottle opener, 2 rulers (mm and inch), and 2 ruler extensions. Patent pending design provides 24/7 pocket-sized readiness. Use with your key ring, purse, glove box, and more.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
Swiss+Tech Micro-Max 19-in-1 Tool with the following tools:

 * 1/4 Inch Hex Wrench
 * 7/16 Inch Hex Wrench
 * #0 Flat Screwdriver
 * #1 Flat Screwdriver
 * #2 Flat Screwdriver
 * #0 Phillips Screwdriver
 * #1 Phillips Screwdriver
 * #2 Phillips Screwdriver
 * Pliers
 * Wire Cutter
 * Wire Stripper
 * Wire Crimper
 * Nail File
 * Hand Drill
 * Bottle Opener
 * Inches Ruler
 * Inches Ruler Extension
 * mm Ruler
 * mm Ruler Extension
feature_bullets: Includes 2 hex wrenches 1/4", 7/16", 6 screwdrivers #0,1,2 flat #0,1,2 Phillips
Also includes pliers, bottle opener, wire cutter and stripper, wire crimper
Hand drill, file, 2 rulers (mm and inch), 2 ruler extensions (mm and inch)
Can be used for camping, outdoors, hardware, auto, hunting - a great men's gift!

specifications.Cover Included: Wire Cutter, Hex Wrenches, Screwdrivers, Bottle Opener, Pliers
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,936 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
